name: tyrannosaurus rex
description: The Tyrannosaurus Rex was one of the largest land predators to ever roam the Earth. With powerful jaws capable of crushing bone, it dominated its ecosystem roughly 68 million years ago.

name: triceratops
description: The Triceratops was a large herbivorous dinosaur recognizable by its three distinct facial horns and large bony frill. Living around 68 million years ago, it used its horns for defense against predators like Tyrannosaurus.

name: apatosaurus
description: Apatosaurus was a large, long-necked herbivorous dinosaur that lived during the Late Jurassic period. Known for its massive size and long tail, it fed on plants high in the trees.

name: velociraptor
description: Velociraptor was a small but fast and agile carnivorous dinosaur. It hunted in packs and was known for its sharp claws and intelligence, living about 75 million years ago.

name: mosasaurus
description: Mosasaurus was a massive marine reptile that lived during the Late Cretaceous period. With a powerful tail and jaws lined with sharp teeth, it was one of the top predators of the ancient seas.

name: allosaurus
description: Allosaurus was a large carnivorous dinosaur that roamed during the Late Jurassic period. It was a top predator with sharp claws and teeth, hunting large herbivorous dinosaurs.

name: parasaurolophus
description: Parasaurolophus was a herbivorous dinosaur known for its long, backward-curving cranial crest. It likely used this crest to produce sounds for communication and to help with visual display.

name: anhanguera
description: Anhanguera was a flying reptile belonging to the pterosaur group. It had a long, narrow snout with conical teeth suited for catching fish, and it likely hunted over coastal waters. Its wingspan could reach up to 4.5 meters.

name: microraptor
description: Microraptor was a small, feathered dinosaur with wings on both its arms and legs, allowing it to glide between trees. It was one of the first dinosaurs known to have had the ability to fly or glide, and it likely preyed on insects, small mammals, and birds.

name: spinosaurus
description: Spinosaurus was one of the largest carnivorous dinosaurs, known for its distinctive sail-like structure on its back. It likely hunted fish and other aquatic prey, and may have been semi-aquatic, spending much of its time in rivers and swamps.

name: pteranodon
description: Pteranodon was a large pterosaur with a wingspan of up to 7 meters. It had a long, toothless beak and a backward-extending crest on its head. Pteranodon likely fed on fish, soaring over oceans and coastlines.

name: stegosaurus
description: Stegosaurus was a herbivorous dinosaur known for the large, bony plates along its back and the spiked tail used for defense. Despite its size, it had a relatively small brain and was a slow-moving, plant-eating dinosaur.

name: pachycephalosaurus
description: Pachycephalosaurus was a herbivorous dinosaur known for its thick, domed skull, which could be up to 25 cm thick. It likely used its head for display, species recognition, and possibly head-butting contests.

name: ankylosaurus
description: Ankylosaurus was a heavily armored herbivorous dinosaur from the Late Cretaceous. It had bony plates covering its body and a massive club-like tail, used to defend against predators.

name: maiasaura
description: Ankylosaurus was a heavily armored herbivorous dinosaur from the Late Cretaceous. It had bony plates covering its body and a massive club-like tail, used to defend against predators.

name: carnotaurus
description: Carnotaurus was a bipedal carnivorous dinosaur known for its short, horned skull and extremely small arms. It was likely a fast predator, hunting smaller dinosaurs with the help of its powerful legs and jaws.

name: giganotosaurus
description: Giganotosaurus was one of the largest known terrestrial carnivores, even larger than Tyrannosaurus rex in length. It had a massive skull and sharp teeth adapted for hunting large herbivorous dinosaurs in its ecosystem.

name: ichthyosaurus
description: Ichthyosaurus was a marine reptile that resembled modern dolphins. It had a streamlined body, long snout with conical teeth, and large eyes, allowing it to hunt fish and squid efficiently in the prehistoric oceans.

name: xixianykus
description: Xixianykus was a small, fast-running dinosaur from the Alvarezsauridae family. With long legs and a lightweight body, it was likely adapted for chasing and catching insects, making it one of the smallest known non-avian dinosaurs.

name: plesiosaurus
description: Plesiosaurus was a marine reptile known for its long neck, small head, and four flipper-like limbs. It swam gracefully through prehistoric seas, using its sharp teeth to catch fish and other small sea creatures.

name: quetzalcoatlus
description: Quetzalcoatlus was one of the largest known flying animals of all time. This pterosaur had a massive wingspan, possibly over 10 meters, and a long, toothless beak. It likely fed on small animals and carrion, both in flight and while walking on land.

name: dilophosaurus
description: Dilophosaurus was a medium-sized carnivorous dinosaur recognizable by the pair of crests on its head. It was an agile predator that likely hunted small to medium-sized animals. Unlike its fictional depiction, there is no evidence it had a frill or spit venom.

name: therizinosaurus
description: Therizinosaurus was a large, herbivorous theropod dinosaur known for its enormous claws, which could reach up to a meter in length. Despite its fearsome appearance, it likely used its claws for defense and foraging among vegetation.

name: yangchuanosaurus
description: Yangchuanosaurus was a large carnivorous theropod dinosaur from the Late Jurassic period. It had powerful jaws and sharp teeth, hunting other large dinosaurs in what is now China.

name: euhelopus
description: Euhelopus was a large, long-necked sauropod dinosaur from the Early Cretaceous of Asia. It had a long tail and neck, feeding on high vegetation with its small head.

name: rebbachisaurus
description: Rebbachisaurus was a sauropod dinosaur from the Late Cretaceous of North Africa, with fossils found in Morocco, Algeria, and Niger. It reached lengths of 14â€“20 meters and weighed about 7 metric tons. It had a medium-length neck, whip-like tail similar to Diplodocus, and a small head with thin teeth adapted for eating plants.

name: minmi
description: Minmi was a small armored dinosaur from the Early Cretaceous of Australia. It was covered in bony plates and likely used its armor for protection against predators.

name: styracosaurus
description: Styracosaurus was a herbivorous ceratopsian dinosaur known for its impressive array of long horns extending from its neck frill and a large nasal horn. It lived during the Late Cretaceous and used its horns for defense and display.

name: oviraptor
description: Oviraptor was a small, bird-like dinosaur with a beaked mouth and a crest on its head. Once thought to steal eggs, it is now believed to have cared for its own. It was an omnivore, possibly eating small animals, plants, and eggs.

name: iguanodon
description: Iguanodon was a large herbivorous dinosaur known for its thumb spike, which may have been used for defense. It could walk on both two and four legs and lived in herds. Its beak and teeth were adapted for chewing tough plant material.
